sections.heading: What is 〜そう (sou) for Observation?
sections.content:
〜そう (observation) expresses your judgment about something based on what you can see or observe right now. It means "looks like" or "seems" when making a visual assessment.

おいしそう "looks delicious" 楽しそう "looks fun / seems fun"

children.heading: With I-adjectives
children.content:
Remove い and add そう:

おいしい → おいしそう "looks delicious" 楽しい → 楽しそう "looks fun" 難しい → 難しそう "looks difficult"

Exception: いい (good)

いい → よさそう "looks good"

children.heading: With Na-adjectives
children.content:
Remove だ and add そう:

元気 → 元気そう "looks energetic/healthy" 便利 → 便利そう "looks convenient" 静か → 静かそう "looks quiet"

children.heading: With Verbs
children.content:
Add そう to masu-stem:

降る → 降ります → 降りそう "looks like it will rain" 壊れる → 壊れます → 壊れそう "looks like it will break" 泣く → 泣きます → 泣きそう "looks like (someone) will cry"

children.heading: Based on Visual Observation
children.content:
You make a judgment based on what you SEE right now:

おいしそうなケーキ "a delicious-looking cake" 楽しそうなパーティー "a fun-looking party" 難しそうな問題 "a difficult-looking problem"

children.heading: Describing Appearance
children.content: このケーキ、おいしそう "This cake looks delicious" あの人は優しそう "That person looks kind" この本は面白そう "This book looks interesting"

children.heading: Modifying Nouns
children.content:
そう becomes そうな before nouns:

おいしそうな料理 "delicious-looking food" 楽しそうな映画 "fun-looking movie" 難しそうな宿題 "difficult-looking homework"

children.heading: Positive Impressions
children.content: おいしそう - looks delicious 楽しそう - looks fun 嬉しそう - looks happy 元気そう - looks healthy/energetic 幸せそう - looks happy 面白そう - looks interesting

children.heading: Negative Impressions
children.content: まずそう - looks bad/unappetizing つまらなそう - looks boring 難しそう - looks difficult 大変そう - looks tough/hard 痛そう - looks painful 寒そう - looks cold

children.heading: States
children.content: 忙しそう - looks busy 暇そう - looks free 疲れそう - looks tiring 眠そう - looks sleepy

children.heading: そう (observation) vs そう (hearsay)
children.content: Observation (based on appearance): 雨が降りそう "Looks like it will rain" (看clouds) Hearsay (I heard): 雨が降るそう "I heard it will rain"

children.heading: そう vs らしい vs みたい
children.content: そう: Visual observation おいしそう "looks delicious" (I can see it) らしい: Heard/Inferred おいしいらしい "I hear it's delicious" みたい: Looks similar おいしいみたい "It seems delicious"

children.heading: About to Happen
children.content:
When used with verbs, そう indicates something is about to happen:

雨が降りそう "Looks like it will rain" (clouds gathering) 壊れそう "Looks like it will break" (it's wobbling) 泣きそう "Looks like (they) will cry" (tears forming) 落ちそう "Looks like it will fall"

children.heading: With Adjectives
children.content: I-adjectives: おいしくなさそう "doesn't look delicious" 楽しくなさそう "doesn't look fun" Na-adjectives: 元気じゃなさそう / 元気ではなさそう "doesn't look healthy" 便利じゃなさそう "doesn't look convenient"

children.heading: With Verbs
children.content: 降りそうにない "doesn't look like it will rain" 壊れそうにない "doesn't look like it will break"

children.heading: Example 1: Restaurant
children.content: A: このレストラン、どう？ "How about this restaurant?" B: おいしそうだね "Looks delicious" A: じゃあ、ここにしよう "Then let's go here"

children.heading: Example 2: Weather
children.content: A: 空を見て "Look at the sky" B: 雨が降りそうだね "Looks like it will rain" A: 傘を持って行った方がいいね "We should bring umbrellas"

children.heading: Example 3: Movie
children.content: A: この映画、見たい？ "Do you want to watch this movie?" B: 面白そう！見よう "Looks interesting! Let's watch it"

children.heading: Mistake 1: Using with いい incorrectly
children.content: Wrong: いいそう ❌ Right: よさそう ✓ "looks good"

children.heading: Mistake 2: Confusing with hearsay そう
children.content: Observation: 雨が降りそう ✓ "Looks like it will rain" (I see clouds) Hearsay: 雨が降るそう ✓ "I heard it will rain" (someone told me)

children.heading: Mistake 3: Using です directly
children.content: Less natural: おいしいそうです ⚠️ Natural: おいしそうです ✓ "It looks delicious"

children.heading: 〜そうもない (unlikely to)
children.content: 雨が降りそうもない "It doesn't look like it will rain at all" できそうもない "Doesn't look like I can do it"

children.heading: 〜そうに (adverb form)
children.content: 嬉しそうに笑う "smile happily" (in a happy-looking way) 楽しそうに話す "talk in a fun-looking way" 悲しそうに歩く "walk sadly"

children.heading: 今にも〜そう (about to any moment)
children.content: 今にも雨が降りそう "Looks like it will rain any moment" 今にも泣きそう "Looks like (they) will cry any moment"

children.heading: Emotional States
children.content: 嬉しそうな顔 "a happy-looking face" 悲しそうな目 "sad-looking eyes" 疲れそうな様子 "a tired-looking appearance"

children.heading: Physical States
children.content: 元気そうな人 "a healthy-looking person" 眠そうな子供 "a sleepy-looking child" 寒そうな服装 "clothing that looks cold"

children.heading: Food
children.content: おいしそうなケーキ "a delicious-looking cake" まずそうな食べ物 "bad-looking food" 新鮮そうな魚 "fresh-looking fish"

children.heading: Objects
children.content: 高そうな車 "an expensive-looking car" 古そうな本 "an old-looking book" 壊れそうな椅子 "a chair that looks like it will break"

children.heading: Casual
children.content: おいしそう "looks delicious" 面白そう "looks interesting"

children.heading: Polite
children.content: おいしそうです "looks delicious" 面白そうですね "looks interesting, doesn't it"

children.heading: Basic Observations
children.content: このケーキ、おいしそう "This cake looks delicious" あの映画は面白そう "That movie looks interesting" この問題は難しそう "This problem looks difficult" 彼は優しそうな人だ "He seems like a kind person"

children.heading: Weather and Nature
children.content: 雨が降りそう "Looks like it will rain" 雪が降りそうな空 "A sky that looks like it will snow" 台風が来そう "Looks like a typhoon is coming"

children.heading: People's States
children.content: 楽しそうに遊んでいる "Playing in a fun-looking way" 疲れそうな仕事 "A tiring-looking job" 忙しそうな人 "A busy-looking person" 眠そうな顔 "A sleepy-looking face"

children.heading: Imminent Actions
children.content: 泣きそう "Looks like (they) will cry" 壊れそう "Looks like it will break" 落ちそう "Looks like it will fall" 始まりそう "Looks like it will start"

children.heading: Negative
children.content: おいしくなさそう "Doesn't look delicious" 面白くなさそう "Doesn't look interesting" 降りそうにない "Doesn't look like it will rain"

sections.heading: Related Grammar Points
sections.content: 〜そう (sou) - I heard that (hearsay) 〜らしい (rashii) - It seems/apparently 〜みたい (mitai) - Looks like/similar 〜ようだ (you da) - It appears/seems I-adjective Conjugation - Base for formation Na-adjective Conjugation - Base for formation Masu-stem - Verb stem usage
